properties.site_description: This reclaimed cement manufacturing site offers a concrete launch ramp to the Bronx River. There is limited street parking and a long carry from either the entrance at Westchester Avenue (.25 mi.) or Bruckner Boulevard (.15 mi).
properties.safety: A boom collects debris and helps prevent motorized traffic from going north; to the south are strong currents and a working shipping channel.

properties.safety: Watch footing on the steep ramp and slippery dock, mud banks at low tide, heavy motorized traffic, and 100-yard security perimeter around LaGuardia Airport.

properties.site_description: Launch from a concrete ramp on a cobble beach near the parking lot or a sandy cove at the east end of the park.
properties.safety: Strong tidal currents and heavy traffic in the main shipping channel; restricted access on both Brother Islands (bird sanctuaries) and prohibited at Rikers Island (city's largest jail.)

properties.site_description: A concrete ramp near the marina and fishing pier offers direct access to Little Neck Bay; the wetlands of Alley Pond Park and Udall's Cove are a short paddle away. Parking and footbridge access at 28th Avenue.
properties.safety: Landing at high tide can be difficult heading south toward Alley Pond Park due to extensive riprap.

properties.site_description: A small 10' by 15' foot dock (150 foot portage) offers easy access to the middle section of the Bronx River, six miles north of its confluence with the East River. Bathrooms and water in nearby playground.
